title:Pandapaxxy's Season 22 Crota's End Breakdown
description:https://www.reddit.com/r/sharditkeepit/comments/16b01e2/season_22_crotas_end_breakdown/

// Abyss Defiant - PvE (mkb,controller,pve)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Abyss Defiant is a high-impact auto rifle with arguably better perks than Ammit. Ammit doesn’t have reliable reload perks but can definitely maintain great damage. Keeping all that damage, bumping it up a tad but slowing down the fire rate is Abyss Defiant’s main claim to fame (that was a mouthful). Reconstruction and Subsistence with your flavor of damage perk will give you a reliable auto rifle to completely destroy whatever is standing in your way. The combination of Heal Clip and Kill Clip is nice to see." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:mkb,controller,pve
dimwishlist:item=833898322&perks=839105230,1087426260,1523832109,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=833898322&perks=839105230,1087426260,1523832109,365154968
dimwishlist:item=833898322&perks=839105230,1087426260,1523832109,1015611457

// Abyss Defiant - Controller PvP (controller,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "High-impact autos in PvP are not strong. Can you slay out with them? For sure. Are they meta? Definitely not. Kill Clip is the strongest perk you can use on Abyss Defiant, and your choice of accuracy booster will keep your bullets true. Reconstruction is here for anyone who dislikes reloading. Eye of the Storm will help in pure 1v1 fights but will fall off in any 1v2+ fights. Swashbuckler could be fun with any of the melee heavy builds to get an incredibly fast 0.67s TtK with 4 crits and 1 body. (psst, with Radiant it becomes a 4 crit kill at 0.50s TtK, just FYI)." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:controller,pvp
dimwishlist:item=833898322&perks=839105230,1885400500,2387244414,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=833898322&perks=839105230,1885400500,2387244414,699525795
dimwishlist:item=833898322&perks=839105230,1885400500,2387244414,4082225868
dimwishlist:item=833898322&perks=839105230,1885400500,1523832109,1015611457

// Abyss Defiant - MnK PvP (mkb,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "High-impact autos in PvP are not strong. Can you slay out with them? For sure. Are they meta? Definitely not. Kill Clip is the strongest perk you can use on Abyss Defiant, and your choice of accuracy booster will keep your bullets true. Reconstruction is here for anyone who dislikes reloading. Eye of the Storm will help in pure 1v1 fights but will fall off in any 1v2+ fights. Swashbuckler could be fun with any of the melee heavy builds to get an incredibly fast 0.67s TtK with 4 crits and 1 body. (psst, with Radiant it becomes a 4 crit kill at 0.50s TtK, just FYI)." Recommended MW: Handling or Range.|tags:mkb,pvp
dimwishlist:item=833898322&perks=839105230,1885400500,1523832109,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=833898322&perks=839105230,1885400500,1523832109,699525795
dimwishlist:item=833898322&perks=839105230,1885400500,1523832109,4082225868
dimwishlist:item=833898322&perks=839105230,1561002382,1523832109,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=833898322&perks=839105230,1561002382,1523832109,699525795
dimwishlist:item=833898322&perks=839105230,1561002382,1523832109,4082225868
dimwishlist:item=833898322&perks=1840239774,1885400500,1523832109,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=833898322&perks=1840239774,1885400500,1523832109,699525795
dimwishlist:item=833898322&perks=1840239774,1885400500,1523832109,4082225868
dimwishlist:item=833898322&perks=1840239774,1561002382,1523832109,1015611457
dimwishlist:item=833898322&perks=1840239774,1561002382,1523832109,699525795
dimwishlist:item=833898322&perks=1840239774,1561002382,1523832109,4082225868


// Oversoul Edict - PvE (mkb,controller,pve)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Did anyone ask for more rapid-fire frame pulses? It wasn’t on my Bingo card. Either way Oversoul Edict is here and requires Arrowhead Brake in order to even shoot reliably. Even with Arrowhead and a Counterbalance Stock you’ll be just shy of perfect at 94 recoil direction. Definitely great, but it’s a shame you’ll have to sacrifice a mod to make it feel like it’s shooting where you point it. In PvE Oversoul Edict doesn’t have the best reload perks. Keep Away and Precision Instrument are both great, Demolitionist can be strong on grenade heavy builds. The reason why I want a good reload perk like Outlaw or Rapid Hit is because of Voltshot. Being able to clear rooms with Voltshot is becoming more and more fun, but having to reload to get the zaps is less fun." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:mkb,controller,pve
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,3230963543,3619207468,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,3230963543,3619207468,11612903
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,3230963543,3619207468,31345821
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,3230963543,3523296417,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,3230963543,3523296417,11612903
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,3230963543,3523296417,31345821
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1087426260,3619207468,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1087426260,3619207468,11612903
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1087426260,3619207468,31345821
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1087426260,3523296417,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1087426260,3523296417,11612903
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1087426260,3523296417,31345821


// Oversoul Edict - Controller PvP (controller,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "In PvP your best bet is to invest fully into reliability perks. Arrowhead / CB mod for recoil direction. Ricochet Rounds for stability. Keep Away for more range and some extra accuracy. Headseeker to keep those bursts consistent. If you play a bit more aggressively I can see Eye of the Storm being a great additional perk but it’s not my first choice." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:controller,pvp
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1885400500,3619207468,460017080
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1885400500,3619207468,588594999
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1885400500,3619207468,31345821
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1885400500,699525795,460017080
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1885400500,699525795,588594999
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1885400500,699525795,31345821
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1561002382,3619207468,460017080
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1561002382,3619207468,588594999
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1561002382,3619207468,31345821
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1561002382,699525795,460017080
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1561002382,699525795,588594999
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1561002382,699525795,31345821


// Oversoul Edict - MnK PvP (mkb,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "In PvP your best bet is to invest fully into reliability perks. Arrowhead / CB mod for recoil direction. Ricochet Rounds for stability. Keep Away for more range and some extra accuracy. Headseeker to keep those bursts consistent. If you play a bit more aggressively I can see Eye of the Storm being a great additional perk but it’s not my first choice." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:mkb,pvp
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1885400500,3619207468,460017080
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1885400500,3619207468,31345821
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1885400500,699525795,460017080
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1885400500,699525795,31345821
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1561002382,3619207468,460017080
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1561002382,3619207468,31345821
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1561002382,699525795,460017080
dimwishlist:item=1098171824&perks=839105230,1561002382,699525795,31345821


// Fang of Ir Yût - PvE (mkb,controller,pve)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Fang of Ir Yut is back and is the first Crota’s End weapon we will be talking about. It is a rapid-fire frame scout with some incredible perks. It might not be the strongest for PvP but for PvE we have some incredible perks. Rewind Rounds and Precision Instrument will keep your damage going and grant you extra bullets refunded. Rapid Hit also substitutes in here nicely as both perks require precision hits. Sword Logic is a new damage perk similar to Rampage or any other stackable buffs. Finally you can use this scout as a faster Taraxippus with Hatchling and Shoot to Loot to pick up orbs and ammo from a distance." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:mkb,controller,pve
dimwishlist:item=1432682459&perks=839105230,1087426260,3418782618,555281244
dimwishlist:item=1432682459&perks=839105230,1087426260,3418782618,31345821

// Fang of Ir Yût - Controller PvP (controller,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Fang isn’t as strong over in the crucible where map design doesn’t always lead to good scout rifle engagements. Being a rapid-fire frame does give this weapon an edge in closer gunfights but I would use another weapon for CQC. The best perks here are definitely Keep Away or Rapid Hit and Kill Clip. Rapid-fire frames feel incredible with Kill Clip active and the accuracy boost from Keep Away or the bonus stability from Rapid Hit will be appreciated." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:controller,pvp

Rapid-fire frames feel incredible with Kill Clip active and the accuracy boost from Keep Away or the bonus stability from Rapid Hit will be appreciated." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:mkb,pvp

// Song of Ir Yût - PvE (mkb,controller,pve)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I did not participate in the raid race, but this weapon was one of the first to reach my ears on being a potential monster. Bait and Switch can put out some incredible damage, and you get to pair it with either Reconstruction or Rewind Rounds, both will extend your magazine and allow you to keep the DPS going. If you prefer less weapon swapping I would go Target Lock to keep damage up and really lay into that boss. Sword Logic or Voltshot are both great at clearing rooms and your choice will depend on how you feel about reloading a machine gun." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:mkb,controller,pve

// Song of Ir Yût - Controller PvP (controller,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Machine guns have not had a dominant presence in PvP since Hammerhead was sunset (RIP). You can make Song of Ir Yut feel great by bumping up all its stats. Elemental Capacitor will juice up Void or Arc builds while having slightly less utility on Stasis and negligible effects on Strand and Solar. I would argue it’s better than Target Lock because you’ll only be getting half a magazine in PvP but if the damage scales like I think it does, it could be incredible (I’ll edit this if I am wrong.)" Recommended MW: Range.|tags:controller,pvp

// Song of Ir Yût - MnK PvP (mkb,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Machine guns have not had a dominant presence in PvP since Hammerhead was sunset (RIP). You can make Song of Ir Yut feel great by bumping up all its stats. Elemental Capacitor will juice up Void or Arc builds while having slightly less utility on Stasis and negligible effects on Strand and Solar. I would argue it’s better than Target Lock because you’ll only be getting half a magazine in PvP but if the damage scales like I think it does, it could be incredible (I’ll edit this if I am wrong.)" Recommended MW: Range.|tags:mkb,pvp

// Swordbreaker - PvE (mkb,controller,pve)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Swordbreaker is the returning shotgun from Crota’s End. Here we have a case of “interesting but not incredible.” Being able to get both Pugilist and One-Two Punch is a fantastic combo, but I feel that most people will opt for Subsistence to forget what reloading is like. Demolitionist is good for grenade heavy builds and also for forgetting the reload animation. In the final column, One-Two Punch is the best in slot, but on a Strand ability focused build you can get away with Golden Tricorn for even more damage. Sword Logic is also here if you want to run through enemies like Doom Guy and shotgun everything." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:mkb,controller,pve
dimwishlist:item=3163900678&perks=1300023272,791862061,1820235745,2679249093

// Swordbreaker - Controller PvP (controller,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Swordbreaker is interesting. It might take the place of the best lightweight frame shotgun. Being craftable, tying with the highest handling within its archetype, and being able to hit 100 range are just a few things that makes Swordbreaker interesting. You can choose a variety of different perks, you only need one handling perk and Threat Detector to hit 100 handling with an animation scalar, meaning you can invest the rest of your perks into range. Going with Smallbore, Accurized Rounds, and Opening Shot puts you at 91 range and 100 handling. Or you can opt for 100 range and 91 handling by swapping a few things around. The best part of this shotgun is its versatility." Recommended MW: Handling or Range.|tags:controller,pvp
dimwishlist:item=3163900678&perks=1300023272,3142289711,4071163871,47981717
dimwishlist:item=3163900678&perks=1300023272,3142289711,3161816588,47981717

// Swordbreaker - MnK PvP (mkb,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Swordbreaker is interesting. It might take the place of the best lightweight frame shotgun. Being craftable, tying with the highest handling within its archetype, and being able to hit 100 range are just a few things that makes Swordbreaker interesting. You can choose a variety of different perks, you only need one handling perk and Threat Detector to hit 100 handling with an animation scalar, meaning you can invest the rest of your perks into range. Going with Smallbore, Accurized Rounds, and Opening Shot puts you at 91 range and 100 handling. Or you can opt for 100 range and 91 handling by swapping a few things around. The best part of this shotgun is its versatility." Recommended MW: Handling or Range.|tags:mkb,pvp

// Word of Crota - PvE (controller,mkb,pve)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Oh hey, another Void 180 hand cannon. I wonder how many of these we have? Not counting sunset weapons, it’s 3. But counting them in it’s 6. I guess I thought there were more. Word of Crota is an interesting 180. If you crafted a good IKELOS_HC_v1.0.3 then you won’t need this one. If you didn’t craft one, then this will be a great option. Subsistence as we know allows us to bypass the reload stat and your choice of damage perks will slot in perfectly. One combo to keep an eye on is the Repulsor Brace / Destabilizing Rounds combo. It won’t scale up to GM levels but in entry level PvE activities it can put in great work." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:mkb,controller,pve
dimwishlist:item=120706239&perks=1840239774,1087426260,1820235745,4104185692

// Word of Crota - Controller PvP (controller,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Precision frame hand cannons are not meta in PvP. Killing Wind and a damage perk can make you competitive after a kill, but that’s just it. It has to be after an initial kill. For most players a 120 or a 140 will do better, just keep in mind a grenade kill with Adrenaline Junkie puts you a 0.67s TtK only requiring 2 crits and 1 body shot. Similar to Kill Clip or old Not Forgotten / Luna’s Howl era. You do need to get a grenade kill first, but it can wipe teams." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:controller,pvp
dimwishlist:item=120706239&perks=1840239774,2450788523,3425386926
dimwishlist:item=120706239&perks=3250034553,2450788523,3425386926
dimwishlist:item=120706239&perks=1482024992,2450788523,3425386926
dimwishlist:item=120706239&perks=1840239774,3523296417,3425386926
dimwishlist:item=120706239&perks=3250034553,3523296417,3425386926
dimwishlist:item=120706239&perks=1482024992,3523296417,3425386926
dimwishlist:item=120706239&perks=1840239774,2450788523,11612903
dimwishlist:item=120706239&perks=3250034553,2450788523,11612903
dimwishlist:item=120706239&perks=1482024992,2450788523,11612903
dimwishlist:item=120706239&perks=1840239774,3523296417,11612903
dimwishlist:item=120706239&perks=3250034553,3523296417,11612903
dimwishlist:item=120706239&perks=1482024992,3523296417,11612903


// Word of Crota - MnK PvP (mkb,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Precision frame hand cannons are not meta in PvP. Killing Wind and a damage perk can make you competitive after a kill, but that’s just it. It has to be after an initial kill. For most players a 120 or a 140 will do better, just keep in mind a grenade kill with Adrenaline Junkie puts you a 0.67s TtK only requiring 2 crits and 1 body shot. Similar to Kill Clip or old Not Forgotten / Luna’s Howl era. You do need to get a grenade kill first, but it can wipe teams." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:mkb,pvp
